boardgame.name: Judges' Handbook II
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
This book, like its predecessor the Judges’ Handbook, is a tool kit, a resource for both players and referees alike with new rules and options for Judges as they struggle to bring order to their city or travel to protect its interests in distant locations. Much of the material here expands on, and supplements, that detailed in the Judge Dredd Core Rulebook and the Judges’ Handbook.
boardgame.rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)

boardgame.name: Pretpark Tempo
boardgame.description:
In Pretpark Tempo you build your own theme park and try to accommodate to the wishes of potential visitors as good as possible. Will you manage to attract more visitors than the other players?

Pretpark Tempo is a card-drafting game with a unique twist. Cards can be played as an attraction or as a potential visitor.

The game consists of two phases. The first phase lasts two rounds. Every turn each player chooses two cards form their hand and then pass the remaining cards to an adjacent player. All players simultaneously show which card they play as an attraction, place it in front of them and activate its special ability. All build attractions stay in play in front of each player to form their own theme park. Attractions all have a type and a theme which contribute to attracting visitors in the second phase of the game. The second card chosen is placed face-down in a shared pile which is called "the visitors' row". All visitors in this pile will make their appearance in the second phase of the game to choose a theme park to visit.

Whenever one or more players have no cards to pass to an adjacent player - the round ends. A new hand of cards is dealt to each player and a new round starts. After two rounds the first phase of the game comes to an end.

In the second phase of the game the visitors in the visitor' row are revealed one by one. All visitors have a preference toward a certain theme and type of attraction. Players compare their theme parks to find out who has a majority in attractions that are preferred by the visitor to decide which player attracts the visitor. After all visitors are assigned you count how many visitors came to visit your park and add bonus points for your attractions with certain special abilities. The player with the most points wins the game.

Pretpark Tempo is a contest for majorities. Therefore, it is essential to keep close track of what your opponents are building and make well-considered decisions during the drafts. It plays best with 3-5 players but also contains a solid ruleset for a 2-player game and a solo variant.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Hoodwink
boardgame.description: A trick taker of shifting alliances, in which partners try to win the same number of tricks as each other, and a soloist tries to sabotage them.

boardgame.name: Squarcles
boardgame.description:
squarcle*, (skwair-cul), n, a graphic symbol consisting of three elements, where each element is either a square or a circle and is either black or white.

Squarcles is a symbol recognition game in which players try to be the quickest to spot the correct squarcle among all the squarcles on the card.

The game uses just 1 card!
You'll also need 4 dice and some tokens for scoring (or a pen and paper).

* I coined this word :)

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dada's Cup
boardgame.description:
Win the Dada's Cup with your horse racing team consisting of one horse or more horses by competing in the different racing programs (from one to nine depending on the chosen program, flat, obstacle, trot).

During each competition, points are awarded according to the difficulty of the race and the horse's rankings at the finish.

Whichever player obtains the most points accumulated at the end of the last race wins the "Dada's Cup" Trophy.

Contents:

1 board for the racecourse with its track.
12 horse pieces and 12 colored bases.
12 Owner cards representing the horses.
108 Acceleration cards.
2x 6-faced dice.
1 blue Mode dice.
1 red Points dice.

boardgame.name: UpLinks
boardgame.description:
UpLinks is a simple polyominoes stacking game for 2 to 4 players plus a solo mode. Sort of like 3D dominoes with dice.

Players roll dice, match, stack and balance polyomino-shaped wooden pieces. Pieces can be linked adjacently or laid on top of another matching piece.

Two pieces must match the die roll. For example, rolling 3-4 means you must align an existing piece with a 3 to a piece with a 4. The two numbers must be either adjacently next to each other or on top of one another.

The challenge is to get rid of all or most of your pieces to win. The player with the lowest value of unplayable pieces wins.

Configurable modes for easy to difficult challenges.
You can play with a 3x3 stack or 5x5 base.

Colourful, precision-lasercut wooden pieces.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: What the F*ck!
What the Fuck!
boardgame.description:
What the fuck ! is a politically incorrect and sassy party game.
Its nomadic format makes it easy to take anywhere with you.

An adult game of questions and answers in which you will have to try to keep your composure in the face of unsettling questions.

Don't blush!

Content: 140 cards, 1 hourglass, 1 dice, the rules of the game.

boardgame.name: Alpujarras
boardgame.description:
During the great Arab Agricultural Revolution, the hardworking Berber people transformed the landscape of the Alpujarra into a world of bounty. With their innovative irrigation and terracing techniques, they brought water to the hillsides to create fertile farmlands. In this game, take on the role of a fruit farmer, diligently working to grow your crops and deliver them to the hillside villages. Life here is not easy, but with tenacity and dedication, you can live a rewarding life close to this wonderful land and all its beauty.

Alpujarras is a turn-based game in which players move their mules around an action track outside the game board. The player who is furthest behind takes the turn and moves their mule to an action space to perform an action.

Actions include: placing a farmer, moving a farmer, expanding an irrigation channel. By performing these different actions, you can grow fruit, which are delivered to the towns, where they are sold for dinars.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bet Your Word
boardgame.description:
Bet Your Word is a poker-like word game where you try to make the best-scoring words.

Using letters in your hand and the central one showing, form your best word and bet to see if it is better than that of your opponent(s).

SETUP:
1. Shuffle the cards and place into a draw pile.
2. Give each player an equal number of coins.
3. Give each player five cards to hold in secret.
 
GAME PLAY:
On each turn:
• A player flips over the next card from the draw pile
• Each player antes one “cent”
• Each player attempts to visualize a word using a combination of the central card any number of letters in their hand
• Any player can then bet a coin
• All players who wish to bet their word, must match the bet and can raise their bet as well
• When betting stops, the players reveal their words
• The player with the highest point value gathers all the letters played, all the coins and the central card
• Players can then replace up to five cards from the draw pile
• Players must maintain exactly five cards in their hands

Play continues with the next player on the left.

The game ends when no more cards can be drawn. At this point players add up their coin values and letter values to determine the winner. If there is a tie, the youngest player wins.

Two additional modes are possible.
Solo mode and "Multiple Choice" betting mode.

The game comes with
• 90 A-Z letter and bigram fragment cards
• 50 coins in various cent denominations

The game has two sizes"
2 inch cards in a 2x2x2 box or
full sized deck of 104 cards.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Clue: Édition Rivaux
Clue: Rivals Edition
Cluedo Rivals
boardgame.description:
It's the Clue game that has 2 players going head-to-head in a battle to solve the mystery!

In this suspenseful board game, players have to find out which suspect is responsible for killing Mr. Boddy in his mansion. Get the scoop on the character who did it, which item they used, and the location in the room where they committed the crime. Was it Mr. Green with the wrench by the coffee table? Did Dr. Orchid use the dagger next to the fireplace? Eliminate information throughout the game in this whodunit. When a player is ready to make an accusation, they secretly look at the cards placed in the evidence folder to reveal Who, What, and Where. A correct accusation wins the game.

Includes a gameboard, 19 clue cards, 2 plastic pawns, 6 character tokens, 6 zinc weapons, evidence folder and die
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dragon Quest Tact
boardgame.description:
As one of the very first console RPGs, the DRAGON QUEST™ series helped define the genre and set the standard for titles that followed.

Since its start in 1986, over 82 million DRAGON QUEST™ games have been sold, delighting audiences across the world with eleven main entries and dozens of spin-offs. Like DRAGON QUEST TACT, many of the titles in the series are standalone adventures that require no prior experience, but are united in that they allow players to voyage through expansive stories, meet iconic monsters and characters, and immerse themselves in colorful, visually striking worlds.

Whether you are new to the series or you’ve been with us from the beginning, DRAGON QUEST TACT will offer you an unforgettable adventure filled with some of the best that the series has to offer!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.description:
Quoth the Raven

boardgame.name: Spectral Vision (Issue 1 - 1984)
boardgame.description:
Spectral Vision
Issue No. 1

Author's blurb:

Pulling together issue 1 took a fair amount of effort, and cost. I had 250 issues printed locally and then managed to persuade a few game stores to sell a few copies for me. In the end I sold around 200 copies – mainly thanks to a good review in Imagine magazine (issue 24 if memory serves me well) – at a small overall loss.

The first issue was in A4 format and had 40 pages.

boardgame.name: Starry Knight Press Catalog 2020
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Starry Knight Press Catalog enumerate the company current and forthcoming products. The Catalog also includes indices of adventures by character level and by series enumerations of adventures.

The catalog also includes five pages of hexagonal maps of the nations of Jarlburgh, Alderburgh, The Red Eagle Barony, Dùn Bhriste and Dùn Bhriste; new non-player characters, and new magic items.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Undercroft (Issue 11 - Apr 2020)
boardgame.description:
The Undercroft
No. 11

boardgame.name: New Worlds APA (Issue 1 - Apr 2020)
boardgame.description:
New Worlds APA
Issue 1
April 2020

Author's blurb:

New Worlds APA is a 21st Century Amateur Press Associations. APAs were a 20th Century phenomenon where individual authors did their own zines (from 2 to 20 pages), mailed them to a central mailer who gathered each zine into collated issues, put on a title, and mailed the issue to all of the participants.

APAs addressed different areas of Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Comic Books. New World APA deals with world creation and development for games and other media.

boardgame.description:
New Worlds APA

boardgame.name: New Worlds APA (Issue 4 - Nov 2020)
boardgame.description:
New Worlds APA

November 2020

boardgame.name: Transmission Burst: Volume 2
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This collection presents thirteen concise games. Each game is presented on one or a few pages; most are aimed primarily at single-session, short play.
boardgame.rpg: Liturgy of the Dragon, or, An Ophidian Year
True Lives of the Cosmic Champions

boardgame.name: Champions of Shaleria: Core Deck
boardgame.description:
If you like card games, you’ll love Champions of Shaleria! This non-collectible modular game is a complete game in a single box. Each core deck supports 2-4 players and is designed for quick gameplay (10-35 minutes each).

Easy rules, fast gameplay. This non-collectable, fully modular card game lets you take on the role of hero; gathering equipment, casting spells, battling through fierce creatures, and questing your way to victory. Everything you need for 2-4 players in a single deck.

This is a competitive game about earning equipment, slaying monsters, and completing quests. On your turn you choose an action to take, primarily either buying equipment or attacking a monster. The player who slays the correct monsters for their quests first wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Count Me In
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Count Me In, the fast-paced card game for the whole family. Between game-changing rules, cards disappearing, and other players out to get you, you’ll never play the same way twice.

Players compete in a steampunk-style game to get rid of their hand of cards. Cards available are number cards (used to increase or decrease the current count piles), direction cards (used to change the direction of the count), and jump cards (used to change the increase or decrease limit of the count).

On their turn, players will play a card onto one of two count piles in play based on the current limitations of that pile. If a player cannot play a card from their hand, they must draw a card and either play the card drawn or remove a non-starter card in play.

At the end of each round, players gain points based on the cards left in their hand. The game ends when a player reaches 500 points; the player with the lowest score wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Монополия: Курск
boardgame.description: A revisited version of the classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Kursk in Russia

boardgame.name: Level Neo
boardgame.description:
A Japanese trading card game, players can use characters from different animes.

description from official website：
版権キャラクターTCGで多くの実績を持つ、ムービックが自信を持ってお贈りする新世代TCG。様々なアニメ作品の登場人物から、自分のパートナーを1人選び、レベルが上がるごとにパワーアップする、「メインキャラ」として対戦相手とバトルするキャラクターTCGです。
Google translate：
A new generation TCG presented by Movic with confidence, which has many achievements in copyright character TCG. It is a character TCG that battles with opponents as a "main character" by selecting one of your partners from the characters of various anime works and powering up as the level goes up.

boardgame.name: Where's my luggage?
boardgame.description:
You got off the plane, arrived to pick up your luggage and found out it was replaced? Whether you've arrived for a vacation, a business trip or a family visit, you probably have exciting plans for the next few days. But first - don't forget to collect your luggage before leaving the airport! Not as simple as it seems!
A visual memory game that will get you started planning your next destination.

How to Play?

On each turn, players turn over luggage cards and spin the


conveyor.

Whenever you find all the suitcases on the passenger tag - you get a passport stamp.
First player to get 4 passport stamps - wins!

boardgame.name: Hideous Abomination: Robots & Rot
boardgame.description:
Not hideous enough for you?

Freshen up those stale monstrosities (or push them further into decay) with this expansion that adds new ways to play and deeper strategy to Hideous Abomination! Rot tiles make other tiles useless. Robot tiles are automatically bolted down and resist Rot. It's a disgusting new dimension to the game!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Sekai no Hate made Itte Q!
boardgame.description: A trivia board game based on a Japanese TV Show with the same name.

boardgame.name: 9DKP: Series 2
boardgame.description: Series 2 for 9DKP.

boardgame.name: 9DKP: Series 3
boardgame.description: Series 3 for 9DKP

boardgame.name: 9DKP: Dungeon Series
boardgame.description: The Dungeon Series for 9DPKP.

boardgame.name: Stamp Collection Cats
boardgame.description:
An auction game of furmidable negotiations for 3-5 players.
As you desperately try to trade your cat stamps with others to build the most valuable collection, the face down cards in the center will slowly reveal which cards are more valuable. Did you predict that the green cat stamps would be pretty valuable this game? Alas, it turns out green cards are worth the fewest points in this auction! Better try and sneakily trade one to another player.

boardgame.name: Tateruto
boardgame.description:
Summon spirits to your field, gain the mana specific to that spirit, and use that mana to buy and build tower cards. Get 7 tower stories and you win!

Tateruto is a competitive and fleshed out mini-strategy game. You're faced with a choice each turn; summon spirits to use abilities and gain mana, or spend mana to build tower stories and inch closer to winning.

Will you steal mana from your opponent this round and risk their wrath? Or do you play the cutest ghost card ever to save up some mana and hope no one comes for you? The mana pool is limited to just 5 of each color, so you have to plan really well.

boardgame.name: Rocks'n'Diamonds
boardgame.description:
Rocks'n'Diamonds is a scrolling tile-based computer puzzle game that can be described as a combined Boulder Dash, Supaplex, Emerald Mine, Solomon's Key, and Sokoban clone. It is a free software game under the GPLv2 license created by Artsoft Entertainment and designed by Holger Schemel.

History

With its release in 1995, it is one of the earliest games available for Linux, and it also runs on MS-DOS, Windows, Unix, and Mac OS X systems. The DOS version is based on code by Guido Schulz. The native Emerald Mine game engine is based on an older version of Emerald Mine for X11 by David Tritscher, which is used to read and play all native Emerald Mine levels.

Since 2014 the source code is available via a Git repository. The game was later ported to various platforms, for instance in 2014 to the OpenPandora handheld.

Gameplay
Rocks'n'Diamonds features gameplay elements from all the games mentioned above, usually in the form of sub-games, although levels can feature combinations of elements from any of the games mentioned above, as well as new ones.

There are currently more than 50,000 levels available on Rocks'n'Diamonds-related pages. Rocks'n'Diamonds can also read native levels from the games Emerald Mine, Supaplex and Diamond Caves II.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rocks'n'Diamonds", available under the CC-BY-SA License.


Description
arcade style game for Linux, Mac, Windows and Android in the tradition of:
“Boulder Dash” (C 64)
“Emerald Mine” (Amiga)
“Supaplex” (Amiga/PC)
“Sokoban” (PC)

Features
classic Amiga style fullscreen graphics, stereo sounds and MOD music
freely customizable keyboard, touch devices and joystick support
classic levels to play Boulder Dash, Emerald Mine, Supaplex and Sokoban
lots of additional level sets available (over 50.000)
built-in level editor to easily create your own level sets
configurable custom game elements to create completely new game elements
graphics, sounds and music can be completely replaced by custom artwork
local multiplayer games (upto 4 players) (if supported by level set)
network multiplayer games (upto 4 players) (if supported by level set)
source code released under the GNU General Public License
source code available in the package and from Git repository
should compile on any platform supported by SDL/SDL2 library
packages available for Linux, Mac, Windows and Android

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Moon Ant Mow Down at Lunar Base: Dirty Ankle
boardgame.description:
The U.S. wants to be the first to colonize the moon, but one small thing stands in its way: MOON ANTS. These moon ants will cause havoc on electrical equipment and must be eliminated before colonization. The U.S. enlists the help of Cleephas Spangler, to rid the moon of these pests. With his 1986 mower, converted to solar power, he will be given the task of vacuuming up all the ants and inject the entire lunar surface with a specialized moon ant killer. All within a day. He will have the usual problems associated with having a mower, combined with the problem of the moon's shadow rending his solar powered mower inoperable.

His one requirement for succeeding in his mission?: Changing the national anthem's name from The Star Spangled Banner to The Star Spangler Banner. Sounds absurd? Wait till you play the game, and you will know its absurd!

Overall winner of the 6th Roll & Write Game Design Contest

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Fire Ant Mow Down at Dirty Ankle

boardgame.name: Ice Pack
boardgame.description:
Ice Pack is a dice stacking game where you try to match a pattern and score points in a limited time frame. Each turn you will roll the dice, choose a die and a column to place that die. That die will then push the stack down and alter the alignment of each row. Using the score sheet, you will choose a matching pattern and score accordingly.

For the solo game, the goal is to beat your highest score. In the two player game, whoever has the highest score, wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sancak Taşı
boardgame.description:
Sancak Taşı ("Banner Stone") is a chess like boardgame, goal is capture your enemy's flag and bring it to your banner-stone.

Each player has 17 figures. (4 footman, 2 hunter, 2 archer, 2 elephant, 2 cavalery, 2 wall, 1 necromancer, 1 banner and 1 banner-stone)
Player as a commander try to defeat his/her enemy with the help of 94 action cards and a d4 dice.

boardgame.name: Wieża imprezowa
boardgame.description: It's the new face of classic Jenga, specially for parties. Rules are very alike - you move wooden blocks out of the tower. Each block contains short task you need to perform. The player who knocks off the tower is the loser and everyone else wins. The losing player has to do the task everyone agreed on before playing the game.

boardgame.name: Jack Jeanne
boardgame.description: Players need to cover their identity and climb their way up to become the main character of the school's public opera show. What will be the future for our protagonist? How will she develop friendship and relationship with her classmates? These questions will be answered when players progress further and deeper into the story.

boardgame.name: Contracts
boardgame.description:
Contracts is a 2-4 player card game where you take on the role of a top international hitman. Your mission is to complete more hits than your competitors to become the most Infamous.

Every hitman has a unique skill so be sure to pick a hitman that compliments your playing style.

Each player has a turn drawing a card, playing an action and potentially attempting an assassination.

Contracts takes around 15-25 minutes to play. Rules are simple to pick up and fun for more advanced board/card game players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lille Storm says Hello and Goodbye
Lille Storm Siger Goddag Og Farvel
boardgame.description:
Little Storm says Hello and Goodbye is a memory game for the youngest kids in which you can also talk about saying hello or goodbye to various things.

The game comes with 6 themed player boards, so you can just play it as a memory game, or you can also talk with your kids about for example saying hello to a new baby, saying goodbye and hello when moving or even saying goodbye to life itself at a funeral.

Children get the opportunity to put their own words on the game's boards and cards, which deal with situations the children can relate to or prepares children for events or circumstances that may be difficult.

The box contains 6 game boards, 24 cards and game rules.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: UpTower
boardgame.description:
UpTower is a block-based tower-building roll-and-write game for any number of players (minimum of two). Play is simultaneous and quick, so there's very little down-time. Because it's a free print-and-play roll-and-write, it's easy for distant players to print their own play sheets and play over video chat.

If you're familiar with the classic Russian block-stacking video game or the board game Coppenhagen, you have a good grasp of how UpTower plays. the goal of the game is to build a tower with the highest, largest floor before the end of the game.

At the start of each turn, one player rolls a die. This die tells all players what piece they must “drop” onto their playfield.

After the die roll, play is simultaneous - You place the rolled piece on your playfield at the same time as all other players. To do this, you’ll mark off one of the four “uses” of that piece on the reference side of your play sheet, then you’ll fill in the spaces where they piece “landed” after you “dropped” onto your playfield from the top edge.

Every turn - before or ater you place the rolled piece - you may place one “at will“ piece. If you do, mark off the “at will” dot for the piece you want to place, then drop it on your board like a rolled piece. You may do this once for each of the six pieces. Note that you get a score bonus (up to 21 points) for your unused “at will” pieces at the end of the game, so choose wisely!

Once everyone’s placed their rolled and at will pieces, roll the die and start a new turn. The game ends when a player reaches the top of the board (the 15th floor) or if you roll the die and that piece has already been used four times.

Your score is your single highest-scoring floor. A floor scores points equal to its level, multiplied by the number of filled spaces on that level – if your 7th floor has 9 filled spaces, it scores (7*9) 63 points. You also score a small-to-moderate bonus for unused "at-will" pieces: 6=21; 5=15; 4=10; 3=6; 2=3; 1=1. High score wins; play another turn if tied.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Caps And Stones
boardgame.description:
Caps And Stones is a fast paced 2 player abstract game that focuses on trying to think 5 moves ahead with an ever changing play area. Games normally take 5-15 minutes to play and it only takes about 30 seconds to learn. Once you get the hang of the basic rules of play, an advanced twist on the rules is available to incorporate into your gameplay for truly mind bending games!

Caps And Stones is a print and play game that only consists of 1 playing piece and you will need to print out about 30 pieces (3 sheets of paper). One person picks the pyramid side (Caps) and the other person picks the rubble side (Stones). Then players take turns drawing from the same pile, aligning, and stacking pieces until a player gets 4 of their side lined up in a square looking down on the play area. The first one to do that wins!

boardgame.name: Territory the Card Game
boardgame.description:
Territory is a high fantasy strategy card game where players battle against one another using Champions to help secure their Territories while vanquishing their opponents’ Territories and Champions. Territory is set in a classical fantasy landscape where there are several tribes exploring the surrounding realms they find themselves in: magnificent and ancient landscapes from a past that is long forgotten. Champions will explore realms, seek out Relics, and cast Spells to combat other tribes in their quest to uncover the mysteries of the realm.

Players play the game with a deck consisting of Champion cards, Relic Cards, and Spell cards. Players also have a small separate deck called a 'Territory Deck'. The object of the game is to be the first person to get 18 points. Players get points when they destroy an opponent’s Territory, Relic, or Champion from play.

Territory is a turn-based game where players place champions on their Territories and Relics in between their Territories during their turns. Players also may play Spell cards during their turns which help improve gameplay conditions. During a player’s turn, in a distinct phase called the ‘Combat Phase’, Champions attack their opponents' Territories and Relics.

boardgame.name: Robble
boardgame.description:
Robble is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 5x5 and 9x9. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.



Definitions

In these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color. The size of a group is the number of stones in it.



Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square. Then,

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to an empty square 'B' in the opposite direction, move stone 'A' to empty square 'B';

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to the edge of the board in the opposite direction, remove stone 'A', and

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to another stone in the opposite direction, replace stone 'A' with a stone of the opposite color.

The game ends when the board is full. Then, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from the board until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over wins. If the board is empty, whoever made the last move before the game's end loses.

If the same board position appears for the third time with the same player to move, the game ends in a draw.



Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.



Notes

Repeating a position is very hard on a 5x5 board, and it is believed to be impossible on bigger boards.

Robble was inspired by Gekitai and Pathwayz.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Colostle
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Prepare to get lost in a world of your own imagination, steered only slightly by the rules within this book. This is a solo role-playing game, a game you can play by yourself. Write your characters journal as they explore the strange lands of Colostle, a castle so colossal that fields, valleys, mountains, and even oceans rest within its ‘rooms’.

Discover 3 incredible character classes and a simple ruleset that only requires pen and paper and a deck of playing cards, to embark on a grand adventure. Play it alone with the rules in this book, or use the world of Colostle and the classes as the setting for your next multiplayer RPG adventure.

But although the rooms of the Colostle are inviting, beware the Rooks, strange lumbering stone automatons that patrol and guard the world’s mysteries.

What will you discover as you venture deep, into the Colostle?

boardgame.name: Brainfart
boardgame.description:
The trivia game where it´s right to be wrong!

In Brainfart, players are faced with 1,100 inane, ridiculous, and laugh-out-loud questions. The challenge? To blurt out the opposite of the correct answer with no time for thinking. It’s harder than it sounds! Who can keep it going the longest and who blanks out completely?

Game-play: Begin play by choosing one person to read the questions in the first round and one person to answer. The answerer should keep answering one question after another as long as they answer correctly (that is, incorrectly). Answers must come quickly, without hesitation. It's up to the reader to decide whether the answers are fast enough, but a few seconds is a good rule of thumb. Answers that take too long are considered a wrong answer and play passes to the next player.

The reader continues by asking the new answered questions from the same card, picking up with the next question. When all questions from a card have been asked, draw a new card from the pile. A new reader can take over at any time.

The player with the highest number of correct questions in a row is considered the leader. If another player beats their record, they are now the person to beat. Play for a set number of rounds, and the person with the highest score at the end wins.

boardgame.name: Battlecars
boardgame.description:
Battlecars is a vehicular combat game released for the ZX Spectrum in 1984. It is based on Games Workshop's miniature wargame, Battlecars. The game is set in 2084 in a future where road accidents have been eliminated by technology, and the world is relatively bloodless; however, people now entertain themselves by drivers using 20th century automobiles in violent, gladiatorial contests.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlecars_%28video_game%29 Battlecars (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Stadissimo Rugby
boardgame.description:
Stadissimo Rugby is a trivia game about rugby.

Goal:
Similarly to a game of rugby, players / teams need to score tries, penalties and conversions by answering questions.

Questions cover (8 categories of 100 each):

rules of the game of rugby
1st French league teams
2nd French league teams
History, geography of cities and countries playing rugby
5 nations tournament and International rugby
glorious rugby players
80/90 seasons and part of 1991
special questions for conversion, penalties and drop kicks

boardgame.name: GeRPSy: Generic Role-Playing System
boardgame.description:
GeRPSy: Generic Role-Playing System

From the back of the book:

The GeRPSy is a universal engine to power your role-playing game. It is suited for the genres of fantasy, sword and sorcery, science fiction, super hero, western, pirates and anything else you can imagine.

Its flexible and light rules allow quick adaption to any genre and background while preserving character depth and role-play.

Combining descriptive and stat-based character creation with a core mechanic running on only three six-sided dice, the GeRPSy is suited for beginners and veterans alike.

To help you get playing, a sample setting called Darkness Awaits with an introductory adventure is included.

Let you adventure begin!

boardgame.name: Rifts: Promise of Power
boardgame.description:
Rifts: Promise of Power is a 2005 video game licensed for the Rifts role-playing game (RPG) from Palladium Books.

The basic mechanics of the game are adapted from the pen-and-paper version, utilizing an action point turn-based system.

boardgame.name: Gunfight at O.K. Corral: October 26, 1881
boardgame.description:
Gunfight at O.K. Corral simulates the most famous gunfight in the Old West, when the Earp brothers and Doc Holliday dispatched the Clanton-McLaury gang in Tombstone, Arizona Territory, in 1881.

The solo game allows you stand in the boots of the participants (you play the lawmen, the system handles the outlaws) during this “30 shots in 30 seconds” encounter in history.
The individual men are rated in variety of categories (gun speed, accuracy, experience, etc.) so the stage is set as you walk shoulder-to-shoulder down Fremont Street… toward destiny.

10 pages of rules, 27 counters & markers, game tables, Historical Placement map, optional rules, Designer's Notes.

NOTE: The PDF edition is identical to the edition published in Panzerschreck #18 (though it does include an extra small map, and roster sheet); those owning the Panzerschreck edition do NOT need to buy this game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Cringeworthy
boardgame.description:
Your next party is about to get super cringey with Cringeworthy -- the adult party game that puts you and your friends in horrible, hilarious, NOT-suitable-for-easily-offended-ears situations.

In each round, the Cringemaster reads a Situation card that sets up an open-ended scenario. Each player then chooses a Cringe card to play and reads it out loud to the group. Yes, you have to read it yourself. Got an "[Insert Name]" Cringe card? Say the name of any player other than the Cringemaster to amp up the awkwardness. Whoever makes the Cringemaster feel the most uncomfortable wins the round keeping the situation card which is worth one point. First player to earn five points wins.

Hot tip: Any card can be a winner if you sell it hard enough. Hate losing? Play an "And then ..." Cringe card plus another Cringe card from your hand to block the win. So grab your morally compromised friends and get your next game night started!

Includes 100 Situation cards and 300 Cringe cards.

boardgame.name: Cloisters
boardgame.description:
Cloisters is a simple but surprisingly deep two-player game, creating the look of a delightful complex of ancient cloisters as play progresses.

Two players take it in turns to place one of the wooden blocks following a simple rule. As new cloisters are formed the monks switch their allegiance, and only a stonemason can make a new opening in the outer wall. The player with most monks at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Meester 1883
boardgame.description:
Nicolaas Meester collapses during his opening speech, before the eyes of the public. The director of Circus Meester, a man of iron principles and many enemies, has been murdered.

Suspects are questioned, evidence is collected. Someone is arrested and the case seems to have ended.

Now, more than 135 years later, you receive a package ...
It contains handwritten documents, thumbed photos, mysterious drawings and weathered objects; Remains of the one hundred and forty year old crime scene.

With these items and documents you have to find out the true murderer of Nicolaas Meester.

In Meester, 1883 players must use their creativity, and powers of deduction to crack codes, solve puzzles, collect objects, and find the truth about the unsolved murdercase.

boardgame.name: Barrow of Sorn
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The final resting place of Sorn is a crumbling ruin; a barrow mound of piled stone and dirt. A forgotten tomb from a previous age. Locals are wary of it, their dreams haunted by a stone coffin and a skeletal king.

Barrow of Sorn is a 20 room dungeon for 3-6 characters of levels one and two. It was created for Crown, an old school fantasy roleplaying game, but can be adapted to any similar OSR type game with relative ease. It assumes that you are using gold for XP; the treasure is large and it contains a dozen magic items (from potions and scrolls to a magic sword) which the characters may acquire. The dungeon is not perfectly balanced and there are portions of it which may be deadly to a low-level party or that can be easily overcome with quick thinking.

It is intended to be run as an introductory adventure, but could just as easily be dropped into any area of your own setting where a lonely barrow could go unmolested for a few centuries.

Catapult Feud: Volcano! Expansion introduces a new game mode. Place the Volcano in the middle of the battlefield, at an equal distance between players. Shuffle the Volcano cards and place them in a pile, face down, at the side of the Volcano. At the beginning of each round, the Volcano erupts, shooting random balls of fire at players.

During the Tactics Phase, instead of playing an Action card from your hand, you may reveal and resolve the top card from the Volcano deck.

boardgame.name: No Satisfaction: Operation Hump, November 5-8, 1965
boardgame.description:
“Heavily engaged by overwhelming numbers, 1st Battalion 503rd Infantry, proved the superiority of the American Paratrooper beyond any question or doubt.”—Excerpt from 173rd Brigade’s after-action report.

The 173rd Composite Airborne Brigade was composed of units from the USA, Australia and New Zealand. Following the US intervention in April, the unit was deployed to Đồng Nai Province to protect the Bien Hoa Airbase. The 173rd was a “showcase” unit that embodied what was to have been an international effort to combat the spread of Communism in South Vietnam. From the start the unit was engaged in battles with the National Liberation Front’s 9th Division for control of the province.

In November two battalions, one from the 503rd US Airborne Regiment and another from the Royal Australian Rifles, were deployed to once again “search and destroy” the elusive Viet Cong. The offensive was dubbed Operation Hump, as many of the participants optimistically felt that once this fight was over they would soon be going home. This time, however, the Communists elected to stand and fight as their brethren had done further north earlier at the A Shau Valley. What resulted was one of bloodiest and violent fights to that point in the war, sowing the first doubts among the US and Allied forces that perhaps victory for them was not “just around the corner”... Perhaps you can do as well or better?

—description from the designer

After an impass on the Northern Front, the revel army starts in March of 1937 the offensive that will drive them to take Bilbao.
Bizkaia 1937 is a card driven solitaire game in wich you´ll have to take Bilbao in the historical period of 80 days (20 turns). Will the history be repeated or will Gen.Mola get out alive from his plane crash?, Will Goicoechea change sides with his valuable information about the Iron Belt or will you have to attack it without knowing its real strength...?
With a 24 card deck and playing a card in every turn, all the games can be different. Every new card from the deck shows what action or actions will carry out the republican side: reinforce, improve their defenses, use their poor air force or to counterattack.
After this, you´ll add the card to your hand, made up of two ones, and you will have to choose with which one of them play that turn. Each card is linked to an event and a number of operations to move, combat, replace losses and use your entire air force. Come on!

boardgame.name: Motu
boardgame.description:
Pau Motu the goddess try to reassemble the island with having been sunk by Yno (an other god).

You will lead the reconstruction of one island trying to match the people with the natural resources to keep everything balance.

During 3 rounds, you will place some island card around your village. After each round some counting will happened, there are 6 different categories.

You will have to choose which one you will score when...
There will be 6 in total :
1 after age A
2 after age B
3 at the end.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Catapult Feud: Vikings! Expansion
Catapult Kingdoms: Vikings! Expansion
boardgame.description:
Build your castles, set up your troops, load your catapults and use your cunning tactics to win the day!

The War for the Floor has begun once more!

Catapult Feud: Vikings! Expansion introduces a new game mode. During setup, place the Viking Longship in the battlefield at an equal distance between players. Shuffle the Viking cards and place them in a pile face down beside the Longship. Take 2 Viking warriors per player, place them in pairs at an equal distance between players. Each pair should face a different castle.

Beware! At the beginning of every round, the Viking warriors move forward, closer to the castles!

During the Tactics Phase, instead of playing an Action card from your hand, you may reveal and resolve the top card from the Viking pile.

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to play.

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed as Catapult Kingdoms: Vikings Expansion.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Demongate Shrines
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Th e nobles of Ardoussarlis were rich beyond compare. But this vast wealth did not make them value their possessions any less. On the contrary, it was their immense greed that built their empire to begin with, and they had no wish to lose their belongings to anyone, not even the grave itself. So they turned to sorcery for ways to protect their belongings. One defence they developed was the demongate shrine — a portal that summons demons to protect their vaults, their tombs, and even (sometimes) their homes.

Every shrine looks like a fireplace, topped with the head of some fantastic or gruesome beast. These animals once indicated which noble house the shrine was built for, but subtleties such as these are no one’s concern anymore. The trap is simplicity itself: if you are not welcome to pass the shrine, but do so nonetheless, a shrinegate demon emerges to assault you until you either leave or die. For the unsuspecting victim, of course, it is the most horrific turn of events! Moreso if they are dragged off to some hell as yet unseen by all on Earth, save for a few Ardoussarlian wizards, as sometimes happens. Or so they say. But then again, no one said looting this city would be easy.

These days, demongate shrines can be found in unlooted tombs,
subterranean passages, and in the ruins of sorcerous workshops. Those locked away remain pristine, but those along routes well-travelled often have coins and candles (and blood, long-dried) scattered on the floor around them.

boardgame.name: The Precipice of Corruption
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The town of Stennard finds itself in desperate need. The crops have failed and famine is imminent. In a bold effort to save the town, the constable sends their best hunters in search of game, treading into the forbidden lands to the west. When the hunters fail to return, a final call goes out, “will someone please help us?” but only your unseemly mob of cutthroats and fortune-seekers are willing to take on the task. Are you a part of the cure to the encroaching corruption or just another symptom of it?

The Precipice of Corruption is a Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG compatible adventure module designed for 12-16 0-level characters. This adventure includes 7 detailed NPCs, 4 new monsters, 20 rumors, and more than 13 encounters, mixing wilderness and dungeon exploration. The adventure ends with 6 possible adventure hooks for expanding the story into a larger campaign.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The World of Sylansse (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, magic just isn’t magical enough!

Throughout the history of FRPGs, most FRPG worlds were created with magic as an add-on. It wasn’t woven into the essential cores of those worlds. Magic was primarily for battle. Sometimes, it was considered in politics or transport, but that’s about it. What happens when everything is magical? This is what we call highest fantasy. Not just high fantasy - highest fantasy!

Sylansse is a world with an enormous amount of magic, but it still makes sense. There are new magics, and some more familiar types, but magic is part of the culture. Yes, of course there are still magical weapons, magic wands, enchanted shield, etc., but this is a world where there are magical sawmills, and the lumberjacks need to make sure they don’t run afoul of any dryads.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. This time the theme is Highest Magic. While we are using the World of Sylansse as an example, it is only an example. We talk about all manner of ways to boost the magic in your campaign world while not letting the balance get out of hand. We know that the specific and generic examples contained here will give you enough ideas to get your imagination going!

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that whether you are a veteran or a starter, a player or a game master, you are all going to find things you can use - ideas to spark characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

boardgame.name: NOM: Simon's Cat Card Game
boardgame.description:
NOM is a fast-paced, family card game for 3–8 players, ages 7+.

Just like Simon’s Cat you’re always hungry. Race to be the first player to eat all your Food, but watch out for Kitten, Mouse and Dog who’ll mess with your plans!

Take turns to play a numbered Food card, playing a higher or lower number depending on whether Simon’s Cat is pointing UP or DOWN. Play Kitten, Mouse or Dog cards to switch the order of play or force other players to draw cards. Or maybe surprise your friends with a sneaky NOM card and find out who's got the fastest reactions!

The rounds ends when one player empties their hand. Then everyone scores for how many food bowls are on their cards and gets ready for another round. The player with the lowest score when someone reaches 15 points is the winner.

Contents:

1 Simon’s Cat card
90 Food cards
21 Action cards


-description from designer

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Rave of the Dead (Supergame 3E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Superheroes and zombies, oh my!

Graveyards and the undead seem an odd fit for the spandex set, but zombies are literally everywhere these days and it's something that comes up more frequently in superhero comics. Genre debates aside, the bottom line is that fighting zombies is fun.

In this adventure, the heroes are called to stop the B-list supervillain known as Baron Bloodthane from raising an army of the dead with an arcane ritual.

Rave of the Dead is a short local to national scale scenario for Supergame 3rd Edition designed to be played in a single evening.

boardgame.name: Traveller Fleets
boardgame.description:
designer summary

Traveller has a rich history of famous naval units and naval starship classes. Now you can design your own naval units for use in your game setting.

Traveller Fleets lets you create and store a collection of naval units. Each unit may contain smaller units and/or individual ships. These sub-units may also contain units and/or individual ships. This hierarchy may be extended as needed.

Units may be edited to indicate type, size, name, and number based on conventions defined in various Traveller products. Ships also may be edited to indicate type, size, name, and hull number using conventions defined in various Traveller products. A text summary of a unit and its sub-units and ships may be exported.

Graphical icons inspired by Traveller conventions are automatically generated for each unit and ship and may be exported.

boardgame.name: Outside the City Walls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six locations outside the city walls that you can drop into your session!

Speed up the time it takes to plan your next adventure with Outside the Walls Mini-Adventure Pack. You get six locations, 6 one page dungeons, maps and NPCs that you can use to plan your adventure. The locations are all set in the countryside of a magical city, just outside the city's walls.

Imagine dropping these locations into your session:

Druid Village, Sewer Exit, Fighting Ring, Abandoned Ruin, Country Manor, Besieged Farm


This pack contains these mini-adventures:

"The Water Spiders," "A Clog in the Pipes," "Country Facepunch," "Dead Miser's Money," "The Sky Raiders," "Farm of Fire and Fury"

boardgame.name: "House of Darkness"
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I keep rent cheap for the young people."

Rent is cheap at this home on Bear Paw Lane. But that's because it's infested with zombies! And bear traps!

This is a system-agnostic location, complete with descriptions, map, NPC and story-starters for GMs and Players alike. The location features a unique and easy-to-reference layout to help GMs start and build adventures. And it’s not just for GMs! Certain players will find the location helpful for giving their characters deep backstory.

Features:

A map location that can be dropped into any adventure that needs a creepy house for rent
A landlord NPC with issues galore
Descriptions and more!


NOTE: The Creepy House for Rent is excerpted from the University District Mini-Adventure Pack, filled with locations near a magical university.

boardgame.name: Grab A Pig
boardgame.description:
Players simultaneously pass cards from their hands to their neighbours in the hope of acquiring a full matching set. When a player completes a set, they must grab a pig from the centre of the table. At this point all other players must also grab a pig, but there is always one pig less than the number of players. Failing to grab a pig kicks that player out of the game, and leaves the remaining players to battle it out in the next round. Last player standing is the winner.

Components: Soft Plastic Pigs, 1 Pencil, 4 Rule cards, 1 double sided Score Pad, 24 game cards (4 of each of the 6 characters).

boardgame.name: Rotten Odds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Several weeks ago, the dead rose from their graves, hungering for human flesh. Those they infected died within hours—and all deceased victims returned within minutes as new zombies. The city fell to the undead in a matter of days, with the survivors ruthlessly hunted down by shambling hordes.

Those who escaped the initial viral outbreak went into hiding, banding together for safety. But with dwindling resources and no sign of outside help, the city is rapidly becoming a mausoleum. Worse still, there are rumors of new viral strains, zombies that have mutated into even more dangerous forms.

You are a small band of survivors, attempting to escape the city before it’s too late. But the journey is fraught with danger, and the odds are stacked heavily against you...”

Inspired by popular zombie movies and TV shows, Rotten Odds is a standalone scenario for the Tricube Tales system and is usable as a micro-setting, but it is also a fully self-contained one-page RPG in its own right. You can print it on a single sheet of paper: The first page includes everything you need to play, while an optional second page expands the adventure generator with examples and twists.

boardgame.name: Biohacker Abilities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Healing Touch

Get new options for your biohackers in Starfinder with the botanical essence of the new aromachology field of study or the massive combat medic archetype! Your healing prodigies can use boosters, inhibitors, catalysts, and stims to enhance combat effectiveness, wipe away fatigue, heal the sick, and more!

boardgame.name: Ride the Rails: Australia & Canada
boardgame.description:
The Ride the Rails: Australia & Canada expansion features a double-sided game board of Australia and Canada:


In Australia, new long distance hexes are available to connect far away cities that provide massive bonuses. The rugged terrain reduces your build capacity even further!



In Canada, multiple clusters of cities await your connections. Toronto provides a bonus for all railroad companies connecting there.


Both maps feature new ways in which the six railroad companies are introduced in the game!

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #26 - Feb 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 80 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #26:



Bexim's Bazaar Pages

Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

Plovin's Rare Documents - each month, a new eldritchd document prop to print for players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages

Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Relicblade Scenario - The Prime Sword pt 3

Frostgrave Scenario - The Zoo

Starbreach Scenario - High Repair Costs

Retro Raygun Scenario - Infestation!

Frank's Orbital Garage - Monthly Ship File

Drowned Earth Scenario - Phase 2

CORE SPACE - New Trader Card


GM Resources Pages

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game


The Crafting Table Pages

Grimdark Refinery - Craft Tutorial

Halls of the Mountain King - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

Incorrigible IMPS - monthy comic strip

boardgame.name: Beast Tamer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From great beast tamers, wild children, and those who mimic and channel the strength of the wilds, the Beast Tamer’s Handbook is a massive collection of new archetypes, feats,
talents, and class options focused on handing new tools to characters to interact with animals, tame them, and bolster them as companions.

Form a bond with a Dream Guide familiar, communing with them during your sleep, charm the animals as a Beast Piper bard, or channel your mystical ki as the reworked and revamped Beastsoul Monk for both chained and unchained monk. New class options, such as alchemists creating micromutagens, blacksmiths performing care and maintenance, investigators and slayers working in tandem with their companions to succeed and go beyond.

This handbook also includes a quality of life rework for the Beastmastery sphere, standardizing the scaling and effects, while also adding new talents for leading your companions
by example, dynamic mounted combat, and obtaining improved animal companions and familiars. In addition, new talents stylized after animals, such as the tenacious serpent’s coiling grapple, boar’s charge, shark’s blood frenzy, and weasel’s athleticism allow your combat practitioners to maneuver, strangle, and charge across the battlefield with
newfound versatility!

The Beast Tamer’s Handbook is a Pathfinder 1st edition supplement and companion to Spheres Bestiary: Magical Beasts and Climactic Encounters using Ultimate Spheres of Power, as well as materials from Spheres of Might, Champions of the Spheres, and other Drop Dead Studio products.

boardgame.name: Enchiridion Alchimia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everything that exists has an essence: a set of instructions from the Akashic Records within the aether on how to look, behave and function. Alchemists can draw these essences out of an object, purify and isolate them, and then imbue them into an alchemical concoction to create powerful arcane affects on the material plane. With enough study, forethought and imagination, any alchemist can have the power of the gods.

I have travelled through countless worlds and realms to learn the secrets of essentialism, how it can be manipulated by man, and how to shape this into the craft of alchemy. I have collated the sum total of my knowledge within this Enchiridion, to guide future students of the craft. There is always more to learn, however, and thus the prudent alchemist must continue his studies and experiments until he has uncovered all the essences of those objects and items around him. Only then will he truly be at home within the art of alchemy.

This handbook will thus serve as a primer, to guide novitiates into understanding the nature of essences, and how these can be extracted to form Alkahests and reagents; and how these two components come together to form an alchemical concoction. With this Enchiridion anything truly is possible for those with a keen eye and an imaginative mind

Inside the Enchiridion, you will find:

Rules to guide you in aquiring and preparing reagents, Alkahest, alchemical concoctions and alchemic culinary dishes
Descriptions of one hundred reagents and Alkahests, what their essences are, and how to use them in alchemical concoctions
Discussions on how to create the perfect alchemical concoction and what to consider
An examination on the influence that astrology has on alchemy, and how to use it to your advantage
One hundred unique concoctions and alchemic culinary recipes from across all the worlds beyond the aether
Instructions on how to create a homunculus, a chimaera and the Philosopher's Stone
An easy index to find every reagent, concoction and recipe in the Enchiridion

boardgame.name: Wrecked Ship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the wrecked ships in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Exalted: The Alchemicals
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Champion. You need not be concerned with the will of the mortal institution known as the Tripartite. They are far to set in their ways regardless. I am Noi component soul of the Maker focused on experimentation, made in Moonsilver and Chief Regulator of the element of Oil. I will be speaking to you about matters this simulation of the Tripartite will not cover.

While you are an unknown factor, the current situation means unknown factors are a necessity. I have been assured by an entity of unknown nature that you will provide useful data and might be beneficial for repairing the Maker’s failing functions. This entity has seemingly convinced the Maker in his dreams to provide the means with which to empower you. Given the limited resources of the realm, I can only provide you with a certain amount of benefits.

boardgame.name: Wissen & Quizzen: Menschlicher Körper
boardgame.description:
In this trivia card game about the human body, the 3 assistants Kara Körper, Käpt'n Quizzo, and Anett Quartett guide through 3 different game modes.

Knowledge: Learn about the human body with 26 different cards.

Trivia game: All players answer questions and score victory points. The player with the most points wins the game.

Card Game

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required. The cards can be combined with any of other Game of the "Tiptoi: Wissen & Quizzen" series for more variety of trivia themes.

boardgame.name: Genial Jack Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Genial Jack is a serialized setting of nautical weirdness and whimsy – cursed sailors, mutant shark-people, lost treasures, mysterious shipwrecks, mythic monstrosities, and, of course, the Godwhale Jack himself, a whale the size of a mountain. This 69-page volume details the endless darkness of Jack’s Entrails, the bizarrely brachiating intestines of the Godwhale: a living labyrinth filled with half-digested derelicts, fragments of swallowed islands, ambergris miners, strange parasites, and tatterdemalion outlaws on the run from Jackburg law. Within you’ll find:

A sprawling dungeon environment with 45 keyed locations suitable for a full mini-campaign within the Entrails, with multiple adventure hooks.
A gazetteer of Herniaheim, the rickety pirate town twixt the Small and Large Intestines.
Three detailed maps of the Entrails.
16 new monsters and NPCs, including such horrors as the pestiferous thrushspawn with their swollen tongues, the toxically affectionate amoeboids, the true vampire squid, and the Dog-Nymph Skulla, the Swallowed Sea-Devil.
8 new equipment items and 14 magic items, such as the corpse-locating Thanatometer, the obscenity-barking Rude Shield, and the Bristling Blade of the fallen hero Horkus the Hirsute.
Rules for the Gutgardeners, an order of druid-scientists able to commune with the “animalcules” in the microbiomes of living creatures.


Inspired by the likes of Gulliver’s Travels, the tales of Baron Munchausen, and New Weird urban fantasy, Genial Jack is written for 5th edition but easily adaptable to any fantasy tabletop game.

A setting and adventure supplement for use with Warpstar!

Welcome to Hegemony.
This supplement for Warpstar! describes Hegemony, the military power of the Chorus. Within you'll find details on this complex organisation, its goals and aims, and the gear it uses across the worlds.
This supplement contains:
Part 1: A description of the organisation and goals of Hegemony.
Part 2: An outline of the Nova Guard, feared Hegemony soldiers.
Part 3: Nova Guard wargear, including weapons, vehicles, spacecraft and drones.
Part 4: New careers for Nova Guard characters.
Part 5: Advice on running Hegemony campaigns and military games.
Part 6: Bunker busters, an adventure for a Hegemony military team.
Welcome to the Corps!

boardgame.name: Warpstar! Omoron
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A setting and adventure supplement for use with Warpstar!

Explore the Omoron Star Cluster, a mysterious group of stars dominated for generations by Duke Petronius III of the Merchant Combine. Now the Duke is gone and his top lieutenants, the Viscounts, are preparing and scheming in a succession crisis that will redefine the cluster. This supplement contains:

Part 1: A description of the Omoron Star Cluster.

Part 2: Description of equipment, tools, and goods that are common in the Cluster.

Part 3: The adventure Jolly Jubilee Jaunt, an introductory scenario to both Warpstar! and the Omoron Cluster.

Part 4: The adventure Bad Business on Alcatrix IV brings the adventurers into the plots of the Viscounts vying for their place in the Cluster.

Intrigue, schemes, and adventure await in the Omoron Cluster!

boardgame.name: Kumite
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kumite is a collection of rules to help GMs and players run martial arts inspired action adventures. This game was inspired by movies like Karate Kid (1984), Big Trouble in Little China (1986) and Bloodsport (1988), as well as other martial arts RPGs and video games.

Although planned for use with ICRPG, the ideas and adventures here can be easily adapted to other games, including OSR titles.

In this version Kumite you will find:

Setting-specific Rules for Martial Arts Action
Character creation for powerful martial artists
Rules for the use of Chi and 20 martial arts techniques
Stats for thugs, warriors, elite warriors, enemy bosses, and mystics, all of them customizable with exclusive special abilities
100 LOOT table for martial arts action
3 adventure lay outs that form a continuous mini-campaign

boardgame.name: Snack Attack
Snack Attack! The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Hungry dinos everywhere! Fast-paced and easy-to-learn, steal snacks in this family-friendly, competitive card game for 2-4 players!

How Its Played:
Players draw 3 cards consisting of food and flavors. Players then take turns stacking the cards on dishes. Once enough food is on the plate you claim it as yours.

Players can try to sabotage each other by playing Picky Eater cards like bitter and sour, or use sweet and spicy to protect their own snacks.

Cards like Rex and Momnisaur also add variety to the game by returning all food to the deck, or forcing players to share their food.

Scoring and Winning:
Every dish that is claimed is scored at the end of a round. Snacks are each worth 1 point, and everything else is worth 0. The winner of the game is the player with the most points after 3 rounds.

boardgame.name: Fotozoo
boardgame.description:
Fotozoo is a very simple and family fun game, here, you will enter the Zoo to demonstrate your skills as a photographer, fulfilling challenges according to the characteristics of the animals, such as their habitat, species, diet, size, etc.

It is a real-time game, that is, all players participate at the same time and against the clock. Whoever collects the most points wins. As there are no turns, all the players play against the time, they can change their animal cards with the animal cards on the table or with other players in order to complete the set described in the objective card to win those points.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Capital Lux 2: Generations – The Expansion
Capital Lux: Generations – Untergrund Erweiterung
boardgame.description:
This expansion includes 4 new power tiles:

- Intruder: The Intruder power makes you play a rebel card in any capital district without triggering the power.
- Vector: The Vector power makes you draw a negative card into your hand.
- Architect: Take one Architect tile and add it to your home base sheet. Whenever you complete the mission on the tile, you receive 2 gold and discard the tile.
- Experimenter: This power makes you draw one Experimenter card into your hand. A 1-valued card makes you trigger a capital power even when you play it in your home base, while a 7-valued card never triggers any power.

In addition to this, the expansion also includes components for a 5th player, as well as 4 new Mentalist tiles to add to the base game.

boardgame.name: Heaven's Lost Property: Sora No Otoshimono
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Heaven’s Lost Property! The world is much like the one you’re familiar with, but orbiting the blue planet Earth is a UFO hidden from the eyes of those below. This circular metropolis is Synapse, a highly advanced civilization of winged cousins to humanity, who look upon their “Downer” earthly kin with scorn from their own Heaven. Within Synapse, all physical needs are satisfied and the residents within live ageless utopian lives. Among their inventions are the sentient androids known as Angelroids, programmed to act as loyal servants to their Masters. They function as both laborers and personalized weapons, especially in the hands of the sadistic dictator of Synapse: Minos.

boardgame.name: Speedy Party
boardgame.description:
It's a last-minute costume party among friends, and everyone is rushing to the nearest costume shop. Each person is trying to gather the pieces of their choice before ducking into the fitting room. Let the party begin!

GOAL OF THE GAME

Find all parts for the most costumes in order to accumulate the most points (buttons) after four rounds. A complete costume comprises three cards (costume + headdress + accessory) or a single card for the bumblebee, bunny, and sumo.

HOW TO PLAY?

The players count together, "1,2,3" and simultaneously reveal the top card from their stacks, and place it face-up on the table.

If there are no complete costumes visible amongst all the cards, everyone count "1,2,3" and flips a new card, placing it beside the cards already visible. Thus, the number of cards visible gradually increases.

As soon you see a complete costume, tap the bell, and announce the name of the costume you saw. If your answer is correct, you take the three cards that compose this costume, and place them face-up in front of you.

At the end of each round, you earn one button per costume you collected.

Whoever has the most buttons at the end of the fourth round wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Munchkin: Misch oder stirb!
boardgame.description:
Four mini-expansions for popular Munchkin settings

You play all imaginable settings of Munchkin? Here you get supplies: 30 cards each for four of the most popular. A colorful mix awaits you:


As any true Munchkin knows, rules are meant to be broken. And Munchkin: Cheats! (for Munchkin) has been created for exactly that purpose.



Time for a thorough investigation with Munchkin Cthulhu: Sanity Check (for Munchkin Cthulhu)! Because being a cultist is a lot harder than is commonly believed.



When the zombies are making the streets unsafe, no one would think of hiding in a graveyard, would they? Granted, it is innovative ... as you'll learn in Munchkin Zombies: Grave Mistake(for Munchkin Zombies)!



Life in a spaceship is boring. Going down to the planet, that's what shreds! But watch out in Star Munchkin: Landing Party (for Star Munchkin) that the reception doesn't get too hot!


You must own at least the corresponding base games, and you can add them to each set. Or maybe you want to throw all the setting games together because you like Cthulhu-Science Fiction-Kung-Fu-Space Pirate Dungeon Adventures with Zombies!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lewd Producer
boardgame.description:
Summary of Game
One day, I was suddenly scouted as a producer for an idol.
I work with my idol and I fantasize about playing a naughty prank on her.
Use the plan you came up with at work to produce girls and get to know them better.
Thus began my life as a producer.

Key Features
It's a clicker game where you can easily watch eroticism.
You can play naughty pranks on over 50 girls.
You can unlock over 90 different sex scenes.

You can enhance it by gaining items in the gacha.
-Top tools/modification parts
You can customize the tool to play pranks on girls with your fantasies.
-apparel
The goods you need to produce a girl.
-idol
You can bring your idol into the office and work with them.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Island of Dr. Moreau
boardgame.description:
Classic literature/movies characters like the invisible man, the werewolf, the vampire, the phantom of the opera, Dr. Jekyll and others join forces in this cooperative game. Their objective is to take down Dr. Moreau, a brilliant but mad scientist who retired in a lost island to carry out atrocious experiments on humans and animals in an effort to create, in his lab, a super-being.
The game offers an unprecedented approach to traditional board game-play where technology, in the form of a very intuitive Web-APP, is introduced. Besides performing many random game functions a new very exiting feature was created: the Map Maker. As the game progresses the A.I. will indicate which new Map-Tiles are to be added to the Map Puzzle. This way, players will have to re-adapt their strategies according to the configuration of the map. All maps will be different and the chances that you will play a map twice is highly unlikely. Besides this, the Web-APP allows players to play (each with their own board game) remotely and in real-time.
Character and weapons upgrades, an underground labyrinth , over 50 weapons and inventory items, many actions to chose from, Attack / Defense tactics, the need to manage physical as well as internal resources and a compelling story-line are the main ingredients of this cyberpunk horror cooperative board game that is the first of an incredible trilogy where the line that separates humans from animals is blurred. Which side are you on?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ambush in Avenwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Resistance is in peril! Lady Briarthorn has been captured by the Baron's forces! You and your tiny band of freedom fighters must race to ambush the prison cart before your leader is transported to a secret location deep in the Avenwood...

The first installment of the Pocket Sized Perils series, Ambush in Avenwood is a 1st level adventure for D&D 5e in the form of an illustrated zine. The double sided PDF is densley packed with all the hooks, maps and stat blocks you need to run a rollicking session of fantasy adventure.
